Great mod, another must-have in my mod folder. And thanks for keeping it up to date and the continued support, its appreciated.

Am i the only one having issues with the scaling:

-cut-

I'm getting the exact same issue as well with the most recent release.
Nathan: any luck getting to the bottom of the cylinder scaling issue?

Here's what Nathan told me he needs to be able to fix an issue otherwise he doesn't have enough info.

1. A description of the problem

2. Reproduction steps.

3. The *entire* output log from after having caused the problem and quit KSP, [zipped and] uploaded to (file sharing site like dropbox).

Can be found:

Windows: KSP_win\KSP_Data\output_log.txt OR KSP_win64\KSP_x64_DATA\output_log.txt (depending on which used)

Mac OSX: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'files'. Scroll down the list and find the Unity drop down, under Unity there will be Player.log Aka Files>~/Library/Logs>Unity>Player.log

Linux: ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal\ Space\ Program/Player.log

Mathijs: you built the latest release using the latest (1.7.0) KAE? If you don't get the same behavior, *please* post what you built.

Folks, my sincere apologies. Been working away at this; so has taniwha, and I even enlisted regex's help. We're still utterly mystified, because it'd be one thing if *nothing* worked, but the cones *do* work.

Voidryder: thanks!

The infuriating thing, though, is that in *this* sole case...nothing weird gets put in the log. That's why it's so hard to fix.

Ha! BTW current issues in mod can't be found in log. But PP without any other mods using KAE, doesn't works properly. "Server logs shows nothing" © CCP

The core of issues in last changes in KAE source.

I have the great pleasure to report that, as far as I know, PP is now fixed.
Huray! Great work. Thanks Nathan!

I have the great pleasure to report that, as far as I know, PP is now fixed.

Just tried out the update, and I can confirm that the issue with resizing and scaling has been fixed, at least for me. Thank you again NathanKell, for this and all the other mods you maintain. I'm pretty sure half the mods in my folder are your work or have been transferred over to you.
Yey! Great work Nathan I realy appreciate your work. Thanks.
Would it be possible to edit craft and save files to swap old Stretchy Tanks for PP ones?
Thanks again NathanKell for the work, really appreciated!

Would it be possible to edit craft and save files to swap old Stretchy Tanks for PP ones?

If you don't mind hours and hours of work, then sure, probably, but why not just deprecate Stretchy Tanks parts? It's not like either mod takes up a lot of space.
Possible, but it would be faster to rebuild your stuff manually. Fastest way would be to just load up your old craft and replace them one by one, can't take too long I imagine.
